intro: Spermacoce lithospermoides, commonly known as rock senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its fruits are capsules that split open to release small, dark seeds. It is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
